SEARCH
Package gw.plugin

Interface PluginCallbackHandler

public interface PluginCallbackHandler
Manager used to execute a block of plugin code within a transaction.

This interface is not be used for normal plugin development. In the "standard" mode when the Guidewire server calls a plugin the transaction is managed by the server and transparent to the plugin code.

Explicit transaction management is only used in "api" mode, where the server initializes an "api" plugin at start-up and the plugin handles asynchronous events during its lifetime. In order to process an event the plugin needs to commit changes to the server using a transaction manager.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static interface 
    PluginCallbackHandler.Block
    Block of code to execute within a transaction

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Object
    add(Object bean)
    Add a bean to a transaction.
    void
    execute(PluginCallbackHandler.Block block)
    Execute a block of code within a transaction.

  • Method Details

    • add

      Object add(Object bean)
      Add a bean to a transaction. Any changes made to this bean will be committed when the transaction completes.

      NOTE: add() must be called from within a Block, if called outside a block an exception will be thrown.

      Parameters:
      bean - Bean to add to the transaction
      Returns:
      Clone of bean added to the transaction. Bean should be referred to using this handle and the old bean should be thrown out.

    • execute

      void execute(PluginCallbackHandler.Block block) throws Throwable
      Execute a block of code within a transaction. Any beans created or modified within the block of code will be committed when the transaction completes.
      Parameters:
      block - Block of code to execute
      Throws:
      Throwable - Any exceptions thrown by the block of code will be re-thrown
